HELLAS.attributes.intelligence.descripti: Intelligence (INT): A measure of the individual’s intellect and powers of reason. Intelligence Rating is the deciding factor whenever an individual attempts to deduce the basic meaning of obscure or unfamiliar maps, dialects, or writings, appraise the relative value of goods, solve puzzles and mysteries, and so forth.
HELLAS.attributes.perception.description: Perception (PER): A measure of the individual’s sensory awareness, taking into account the abilities of sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch, plus such intangibles as instinct, intuition, and psychic talents. Perception Rating is the deciding factor whenever an individual attempts to detect unseen presences or ambushes, detect illusions, locate lost or hidden articles, notice important details or changes in surroundings, or utilize any sensory ability.
HELLAS.attributes.will.description: WILL (WIL): A measure of the individual’s willpower, determination, faith, and wisdom. Will Rating determines how well a character is able to resist temptation, bribery, seduction, torture, coercion, interrogation, or influence
HELLAS.attributes.charisma.description: Charisma (CHA): A measure of the individual’s powers of persuasiveness, including such intangibles as leadership and the ability to command the respect of others. Charisma Rating affects a character’s ability to lead or persuade other individuals, make a favorable impression, negotiate, bargain, or haggle.
HELLAS.attributes.strength.description: Strength (STR): A measure of an individual’s physical power. Strength Rating determines how much weight a character can carry or lift, how much damage a character does with a handheld weapon, and so forth. It is also the deciding factor in attempts to bend or break an object, force open or hold shut a door, and restrain other characters or creatures.
HELLAS.attributes.constitution.descripti: Constitution (CON): A measure of the individual’s endurance, stamina, and durability. Constitution Rating determines how well a character can resist the effects of disease, wounds, poisons, toxins, exposure, hunger, and thirst.
HELLAS.attributes.dexterity.description: Dexterity (DEX): A measure of the individual’s agility, coordination, and maneuverability. Dexterity Rating is an important factor in most physical skills and determines how well a character can perform acts of manual dexterity, dodge or evade an attack, keep his or her balance, or catch a thrown object.
HELLAS.attributes.speed.description: Speed (SPD): A measure of how swiftly an individual is capable of moving, either on land, in the water, through the air, or by other means. Speed Rating determines Initiative in combat, as well as attempts to pursue others or escape pursuit.
HELLAS.attributes.combatrating.descripti: Combat Rating (CR): A measure of a character’s natural ability in combat situations. It reflects a combination of physical and mental attributes, cultural and social factors, biological traits, and personal inclination. Combat Rating serves as the modifier for most combat-related skills. Combat Rating affects a character’s ability to attack as well as defend.
HELLAS.attributes.dynamism.description: Dynamism Rating (DYN): This Attribute unlocks the inner power of the Hero to manipulate the universe.
HELLAS.attributes.glory.description: Glory: A Hero’s Glory encompasses his deeds and reputation throughout the Known Worlds. This value represents his performance, special abilities, attitude, and all the other subtle acts that together represent his stature in the eyes of individuals.
HELLAS.attributes.heropoints.description: Hero Points: Hero Points represents the cosmic luck that all Heroes have in fiction — that little bit extra that gets him through the harrowing ordeal. There is always something different about a Hero that helps him stand apart from his more mundane counterpart. He is able to climb the mountain no sane person would, he can fight and best a lion, and he can take injury that would lay a normal person low. This is illustrated by the Hero spending Hero Points.
HELLAS.attributes.hitpoints.description: Hit Points: This is a measure of how much injury a character can sustain before dying
HELLAS.attributes.fatepoints.description: Fate Points: A code of honor and a sense of justice go along with being a Hero, but all great Heroes also have a Fate, and most often they are tragic. Those who ignore their ideals erode something from their Heroic nature, represented by Fate Points. Heroes gain Fate Points by Tempting Fate and failing. Fate Points moves the Hero closer to death and his Fate

HELLAS.item.skill.specifier.all.included: If you have one or more levels in this skill then you have all variations of this skill (specifiers vs attributes). Create multiple variations at the same level as needed to roll against an attribute with a rating.
HELLAS.item.skill.specifier.only.one_inc: Having levels in this skill only provides a single specific variation (specifier or attribute). To get different variations you must separately gain levels in a different combination
Having levels in this skill only provides a single mode. To get different modes you must separately gain levels in a different one
HELLAS.item.skill.multi.attribute.normal: Please select the appropriate attribute to accompany this variation
HELLAS.item.skill.multi.attribute.etique: However you do get both variations of attribute with which ever culture you specify.

HELLAS.roll.modifiers.dialog.dod.title: Degree of Difficulty: how hard an action is to perform. Negative = hard, Positive = easy
HELLAS.roll.modifiers.dialog.nonproficie: Non-proficiency with a weapon penalty, or unskilled/substitution use of a skill that you do not have
HELLAS.roll.modifiers.dialog.multipleact: Multi-action penalty: The number of actions you have already performed this combat round × -5; it will be partially offset by your SPD
HELLAS.roll.modifiers.dialog.dod.tooltip:
Degree of Difficulty
No chance of failureNo need to roll
Any fool could do it+10
Very Easy+7
Easy+5
Simple+3
Routine+0
Tricky-3 to -6
Difficult-7 to -10
Very Difficult-11 to -15
Extreme-16 to -20
Beyond Extreme-21 or more

HELLAS.weapon.skillid.title: Skill used with this weapon
HELLAS.weapon.acc.title: (ACC) Accuracy modifier that is either added or subtracted from the attack roll
HELLAS.weapon.dr.title: (DR) Base Damage Rating: Minimum damage the weapon inflicts upon a successful attack
HELLAS.weapon.modifier.title: Modifier
HELLAS.weapon.wt.title: (WT) Weight
HELLAS.weapon.str.title: (STR) Minimum strength of character before -2 * Δ (delta) attack roll modifier
HELLAS.weapon.rof.title: (RoF) Rate of Fire: The weapon is considered an automatic fire weapon and may take advantage of the automatic weapon rules when its RoF is 2 or more
HELLAS.weapon.ammo.title: Ammo: Ammunition type and aspects
HELLAS.weapon.rng.title: (Rng) Range: If not empty is considered a missile, -4 * Δ (delta), weapon for purposes of STR attack roll modifier
HELLAS.weapon.price.title: Price
